org.colomoto.mddlib

Class PathSearcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.colomoto.mddlib.PathSearcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Integer>

    public class PathSearcher
extends Object
implements Iterable<Integer>
    Iterate over the paths in MDDs, optionally filtering on the leaf values.

    It provides an integer array defining the path (reused for each path) and returns the leaf value for each path found. In the path representation, some variables may have undefined values, meaning that their value does not change the reached leaf.

    It implements Iterable, so you can use a for loop on it directly. Note that the bundled iterator will fill the path automatically, so that you do not have to call fillPath explicitly but you will have to do it when using the raw searcher.

    The same path searcher can be reused for different MDDs.

    Warning: the provided iterator changes the instance: you can not use several iterators separately as their next() method will affect each other.

    Author:
    Aurelien Naldi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PathSearcher(MDDManager ddmanager)
      Create a new path searcher accepting any value (negative leaves are not allowed)

      Create a new path searcher, with a single value.
      PathSearcher(MDDManager ddmanager, int minvalue, int maxvalue)
      Create a new path searcher, with a value range.

        Create a new path searcher accepting any value (negative leaves are not allowed)

        Create a new path searcher, with a single value.
        Parameters:

      • PathSearcher

        public PathSearcher(MDDManager ddmanager,
            int minvalue,
            int maxvalue)
        Create a new path searcher, with a value range.
        Parameters:
        ddmanager - The MDD manager in which this search works.
        minvalue - minimal value of the reached leaves
        maxvalue - maximal value of the reached leaves

    • Method Detail

      • setNode

        public int[] setNode(int node)
        Start looking up path for a new node.

        Note that the node must come from the same MDD manager. For performance reasons, the same array will be reused when searching for the next path, copy its content if you need to keep it.

        Parameters:
        node - a new node index
        Returns:
        a reusable array denoting a path to a valid leaf or null if no more leaf are found

      • getPath

        public int[] getPath()
        Get the int[] used to store the found path. This returns the same array as setNode(int) and is only provided as convenience when you obtained a pre-configured searcher.
        Returns:
        a reusable array denoting a path to a valid leaf or null if no more leaf are found

      • fillPath

        public void fillPath()
        fill the path (returned by setNode(int)) with the last leaf found.
        See Also:
        getNextLeaf()

      • getNextLeaf

        public int getNextLeaf()
        Lookup the next leaf in this MDD.

        This will lookup the next leaf and return its value but it will _NOT_ update the path. for this you have to call fillPath() explicitly.

        Returns:
        the value of the next leaf, or -1 after the last one.
        See Also:
        fillPath()

      • iterator

        public Iterator<Integer> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<Integer>

      • countPaths

        public int countPaths()
        Count the number of paths found for the current node. Note that this will enumerate all paths (using the associated iterator)
        Returns:
        the number of paths found
